title: Man accused of 5 murders to be arraigned again
content:
According to a spokesman for the Cuyahoga County Prosecutor's Office, that office is now seeking the death penalty for James Sparks-Henderson, now 20, of Shaker Heights now faces 46 counts in a superseding indictment for a Nov. 21, 2014 incident where he killed five people.
He is scheduled to be arraigned on the superseding indictment at 8:30 a.m. April 19.
He was originally arrested May 6, 2015 at a McDonald's in Lakewood, originally indicted on May 14, 2015, and had bond set for $7.5 million on May 19, 2015.
He was referred to a psychiatric clinic for examination on Feb. 25, 2016, according to court records.
Charges include aggravated murder, attempted murder, felonious assault, aggravated burglary, aggravated robbery, having weapons under disability and carrying a concealed weapon.
On Nov. 21, 2014, Sherita L. Johnson, 41, her unborn baby boy, and Sherita's son, 19-year-old Ja'rio Taylor, were shot and killed inside a home in the 1400 block of East 92nd Street. 60-year-old Lemon Bryant and 17-year-old Shaylona Williams were also killed.
Sparks-Henderson was 19 at the time of the murders. Police say he was carrying the same gun used in the murders when he was arrested at the McDonald's.
In his statements to police, Sparks-Henderson said he sat down and ate after the murders.
Investigators say Henderson was best friends with one of the murder victims, Ja'Rio Taylor.
